Integrate FileProvider to fix crash on Android 7.0+
body:
Hi, this is a fix for #319 .

In Android 7.0+, strict file accessing policy is enforced to apps so we cannot simply use `Intent` to open files in external editors. Instead, we need to integrate ContentProvider mechanism.

Google's guideline on this issue is here: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/v4/content/FileProvider

This pull-req is a simple adaption of v4.content.FileProvider and supports exposing all `external` storage which I suppose is the correct behavior (and how MGit behaves for Android ~6.0). I kept prior implementation as it was for Android ~6.0 to keep backward compatibility.

Actually, the `<external-path name="external" path="/" />` entry is most likely interpreted as `/storage/emulated/0` (or .../10 for secondary user) so MGit's default storage path; `/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/me.sheimi.sgit/files/repo` is included by default and things will work just fine.

title: Undescriptive Error Message When Failing to Clone Repo
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
If a user mistypes the URL when cloning a Git repo, the cloning will obviously fail.

However the failure message does not tell the user what went wrong.

It merely says "Invalid Remote", and "Clone failed".

Logcat reveals the following (actually helpful) message:

> `fatal: '/some-repo.git' does not appear to be a git repository

This would occur if the user had meant to type '~/some-repo.git' instead (home-relative instead of absolute path).

Would be nice if this message could be passed along to the user so they don't have to check logcat or make blind guesses about what went wrong.

title: Conscrypt isn't installed if RepoListActivity isn't the entry point
body:
If I close an app using home button, it directly gets killed by the LMK.
If I close MGit while in `RepoDetailActivity` and then reopen and try to pull, fetch or push it fails with the original SSL error.
This is because the SSL provider is installed in `RepoListActivity`. Since somebody requested to add an automated pull, which requires a `Service` or something else that isn't an `Activity`, we'd get problems while implementing that.
It should be installed after ACRA in the `Application`.

title: Enforce usage of secure cyphersuites and protocol versions in TLS
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
As I understand, it is not enforced for now.

https://github.com/eclipse/jgit/blob/5d64d3d83a60f3663e22786eeed7cec03fe6ed40/org.eclipse.jgit.http.apache/src/org/eclipse/jgit/transport/http/apache/HttpClientConnection.java#L173

As you see, no additional work to disable weak cyphersuites is done and TLS 1.0 is allowed.

Also on Android <=4.4.4 TLS 1.2 is not used by default, you need to enforce it to make it work. Since GH [have dropped](https://github.com/blog/2507-weak-cryptographic-standards-removed) old modes, MGit stopped working on <=4.4.4. To make it work you need to enforce 1.2.

I have initialized two local repos, both with the same results.

1. add back buttons to all file explorers that could still *default* to the traditional storage directory
1. root all file explorers to `/mnt/` instead? is that portable? or even `/`? (would be confusing for non-experts)
1. make the root directory configurable?
1. devise a smarter solution that could detect what is available?

title: Unclear "Invalid Remote" toast message on clone failure
label: [Label(name="Priority"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
## Synopsis

This is more of a request than a bugfix.

Attempting to clone a repository failed with simply an "Invalid Remote" toast message. It took me a long while to diagnose the culprit, but a more verbose message would have likely made me realize my error more quickly.

## Details

The "Invalid Remote" toast was being issued from within the `CloneRepo()` method in `me.sheimi.sgit.repo.tasks.repo.CloneTask` class. In particular, a caught `InvalidRemoteException` from JGit was issuing a toast with simply the `error_invalid_remote` string.

Looking at logcat at the moment that clone fails, the following error from JGit is logged:

    System.err: Caused by: org.eclipse.jgit.errors.NoRemoteRepositoryException: ssh://git@example.com/some-repo.git: fatal: '/some-repo.git' does not appear to be a git repository

I realized that I was simply giving a home-relative path instead of an absolute path.

## Proposal

Since an `InvalidRemoteException` is just a `Throwable`, perhaps the output of `getLocalizedMessage()` could be appened to the toast.

title: Editor removes newline character from the end of the file
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="editor")]
body:
_From @teresaejunior on October 6, 2016 15:54_

The internal editor removes the newline character from the end of the file, which makes the following appear on the git diff: "\ No newline at end of file".

Besides, a newline at the end of text files is the standard defined by POSIX, and all Unix tools expect this convention and work with it. References:
- http://stackoverflow.com/a/729795
- http://unix.stackexchange.com/a/18789
